    • Method Detail

      • escapeSpecialCharacter

        public static java.lang.String escapeSpecialCharacter​(java.lang.String name,
                                                      JDBCUtil.ConnectorType type)
        Static escapeSpecialCharactor() method will convert the special characters into the readable format which will be compatible for different managed system. For the future use and compatibility of every database connector the connectorType is given in the signature of method which will recognize the different database.
        Returns:
        String formated string which will be compatible with managed system environment NOTE this method is introduced for the e-fix of bug#20623-6.2p and 6.3 Oracle Apps connector fails on password update due to ' apostrophe character in description

      • formatUrl

        protected static java.lang.String formatUrl​(java.lang.String template,
                                            java.lang.String host,
                                            java.lang.String port,
                                            java.lang.String database)
        Given a URL template and arguments, format a template. Recognized template characters are: % literal % h host p port d database

      • getConnection

        public static java.sql.Connection getConnection​(java.util.Map args)
                                         throws GeneralException
        Establish a connection. It is relatively uncommon for a rule to call this directly, though it might be used for more control The caller must pass down sufficient arguments to establish a connection. The following arguments are recognized: 
           type            the name of one of the built in database types
   driverClass     JDBC driver class
   driverPrefix    name under which driver is registered
   url             full url or template
   host            host name/ip
   port            port
   database        database name (for example, master, personel)
   user            proxy user name
   password        password (text or encrypted)
   disablePooling  boolean to indicate if we should disable pooling
                   of connections. Pooling is enabled by default from
                   this method.
        Passing driverClass and driverPrefix or type is required in order to register the JDBC driver. Passing type is easiest if you want one of the common builtin types. If you pass none of these, we will attempt the connection anyway hoping that the driver has already been registered, this might fail. The recognized types are: oracle, sqlserver, sybase The "url" is required, it can either be a fullly formatted connection url that includes host, port and database. Or it can be a template into which the explicit host/port/database arguments will be inserted. Using a url template is convenient if the host/port/database are exposed as rule arguments. user and password are optionl if "url" is specified and the user and password are encoded within the url. This is unusual though some drivers support it. Normally they are passed as explicit arguments. Connection pooling is handled via the commons-dbcp pooling. Beyond connection parameters the following arguments can be used: 
             sql          SQL statement to execute
     arg1         optional argument for sql statement
     maxActive    Maximum number of active connections in any one pool default 10
     maxIdle      Maximum idle object allowed in the thread defaults to 5
     evictRuns    Time in milliseconds to run the eviction thread defaults to 15mins
     minEvictIdle Time in milliseconds before an idle connection gets evicted
        Throws:
        GeneralException

      • getConnection

        public static java.sql.Connection getConnection​(java.lang.String driverClass,
                                                java.lang.String driverPrefix,
                                                java.lang.String url,
                                                java.lang.String user,
                                                java.lang.String password,
                                                java.util.Properties props)
                                         throws GeneralException
        Simpler non-pooled connection with additional properties.
        Parameters:
        driverClass - : Database driver class
        driverPrefix - : Database driver prefix
        url - : URL for database connection.
        user - : User for database connection.
        password - : Password for database connection.
        props - : Additional properties.
        Throws:
        GeneralException

      • escapeSpecialCharactor

        public static java.lang.String escapeSpecialCharactor​(java.lang.String name,
                                                      JDBCUtil.ConnectorType type)
        Static escapeSpecialCharactor() method will convert the special characters into the readable format which will be compatible for different managed system. For the future use and compatibility of every database connector the connectorType is given in the signature of method which will recognize the different database.
        Returns:
        String formated string which will be compatible with managed system environment NOTE this method is introduced for the e-fix of bug#20623-6.2p and 6.3 Oracle Apps connector fails on password update due to ' apostrophe character in description

      • initializeSession

        public static void initializeSession​(java.sql.Connection connection,
                                     int userId,
                                     int responsibilityID,
                                     int applicationID)
                              throws java.lang.Exception
        This function initializes a session so that created_by and last_updated_by fields are initialized with the user's userId.
        Parameters:
        connection - A connection (session) with the database.SQL statements are executed and results are returned within the context of a connection.
        userId - user id from FND_USER.
        responsibilityID - Responsibility id of 'PREFERENCES' responsibility key.
        applicationID - Application id of application name 'ICX'.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - A generic exception thrown when operation fails.

      • getOracleDBVersionDetails

        public static java.lang.String getOracleDBVersionDetails​(java.sql.Connection connection,
                                                         java.lang.String applicationName,
                                                         java.lang.String applicationType)
        A method which fetches Oracle Database's installation details. Uses the 'v$version' data dictionary. Logs an exception instead of throwing one. Sample output from logs: 2020-01-08T14:14:04,356 WARN http-nio-8080-exec-10 sailpoint.connector.OracleDBConnector:396 - Installation details : Oracle Database 12c Enterprise Edition Release 12.2.0.1.0 - 64bit Production PL/SQL Release 12.2.0.1.0 - Production CORE 12.2.0.1.0 Production TNS for Linux: Version 12.2.0.1.0 - Production NLSRTL Version 12.2.0.1.0 - Production
        Parameters:
        connection - A non-null database connection.
        applicationName - The name of the application requesting this information.
        applicationType - The type of the application requesting this information.

      • getOracleDBTimeZoneDetails

        public static java.lang.String getOracleDBTimeZoneDetails​(java.sql.Connection connection,
                                                          java.lang.String applicationName,
                                                          java.lang.String applicationType)
        A method which fetches Oracle Database's timezone version details. Uses the 'v$timezone_file' data dictionary. This dictionary has 2 columns in 11g systems and 3 columns in systems versioned 12. Logs an exception instead of throwing one. Sample output from logs: 2020-01-08T14:14:04,373 WARN http-nio-8080-exec-10 sailpoint.connector.OracleDBConnector:397 - Timezone details : FILENAME = timezlrg_26.dat VERSION = 26
        Parameters:
        connection - A non-null database connection.
        applicationName - The name of the application requesting this information.
        applicationType - The type of the application requesting this information.

      • getTableMetadata

        public static java.util.Map<java.lang.String,​java.lang.Object> getTableMetadata​(java.sql.Connection connection,
                                                                                      java.util.Map tableParams)
                                                                               throws java.sql.SQLException
        Method to get metadata of database tables.
        Parameters:
        connection - connection object
        tableParams - table params required to fetch table metadata
        Returns:
        Metadata in the form of map
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException

        Parameters:
